questions.question: Which of the following quantities determines the linear momentum of an object?
What is the unit of momentum in the International System of Units (SI)?
According to the impulse-momentum principle, what happens to the momentum of an object when a constant force is applied to it?
Which law states that the total momentum of an isolated system remains constant unless acted upon by an external force?

answers.d: Law of Conservation of Linear Momentum

questions.question: In a perfectly elastic collision between two objects, what happens to the total kinetic energy of the system?
What is the coefficient of restitution (e) for a perfectly inelastic collision?
Which factor could affect the accuracy of experimental results when investigating the conservation of linear momentum and kinetic energy in collisions?
How would you calculate the percentage difference in momentum before and after a collision?

answers.a: Subtract the final momentum from the initial momentum
answers.b: Divide the difference in momentum by the initial momentum
answers.c: Multiply the difference in momentum by 100

questions.question: What does the law of conservation of linear momentum imply about the total momentum of a closed system?
What is the purpose of using an air track in collision experiments?

answers.d: To provide a cushioning effect during collisions

questions.question: Two scenarios of head-on collision are shown: Scenario 1: Objects separate with a large relative speed after collision. Scenario 2: Objects move together with the same velocity after collision. Which option correctly relates the coefficient of restitution e to the scenarios?
